com.almasb.fxgl.audio

Class Sound

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.almasb.fxgl.audio.Sound

extends Object
    Represents a short sound in .wav file.
    Author:
    Almas Baimagambetov (AlmasB) (almaslvl@gmail.com)

    • Method Detail

      • setBalance

        public void setBalance(double balance)
        The balance, or left-right setting, of the audio output. The range of effective values is [-1.0, 1.0] with -1.0 being full left, 0.0 center, and 1.0 full right. The default value is 0.0.
        Parameters:
        balance - sound balance

      • getBalance

        public double getBalance()
        Returns:
        balance of the audio output

      • setPan

        public void setPan(double pan)
        The relative "center" of the clip. A pan value of 0.0 plays the clip normally where a -1.0 pan shifts the clip entirely to the left channel and 1.0 shifts entirely to the right channel. Unlike balance this setting mixes both channels so neither channel loses data. Setting pan on a mono clip has the same effect as setting balance, but with a much higher cost in CPU overhead so this is not recommended for mono clips.
        Parameters:
        pan - sound pan

      • getPan

        public double getPan()
        Returns:
        sound pan value

      • setRate

        public void setRate(double rate)
        The relative rate at which the clip is played. Valid range is 0.125 (1/8 speed) to 8.0 (8x speed); values outside this range are clamped internally. Normal playback for a clip is 1.0; any other rate will affect pitch and duration accordingly.
        Parameters:
        rate - sound rate

      • getRate

        public double getRate()
        Returns:
        sound rate

      • setCycleCount

        public void setCycleCount(int count)
        The number of times the sound is to be played in the range [1..Integer.MAX_VALUE]
        Parameters:
        count - number of times to play

      • getCycleCount

        public int getCycleCount()
        Returns:
        number of times sound to be played
